definition: to give a favor (used of Christian God)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我離開奸詐的道，開恩將你的律法賜給我。

sentences.english: Keep me from deceitful ways; be gracious to me through your law.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我離開奸詐的道，開恩將你的律法賜給我。

sentences.english: Roundtrip Economy class air ticket for Hong Kong and Cairns on QF.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲航空公司來回香港至開恩斯經濟客位機票。

sentences.english: 42Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he canceled the debts of both.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們無力償還，債主就開恩免了他們兩個人的債。

sentences.english: Hath God forgotten to be gracious?
